intro: Strobilanthes yangtsekiangensis, commonly known as the Yangtze River strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually arranged in dense clusters and display vibrant colors, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
